This plan will not be discussed in the GMS, in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability. This policy is valid for 6 months since March 18, 2025. Here is the compilation of the buyback details for each company: [Image content describing buyback details for three companies - details of which are presented separately as tickerNews items if they focus on a specific ticker]. marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Role Strengthening and Royalty Rate Plan
marketNews.content: The Chairman of Commission XI of the DPR, Mukhamad Misbakhun, stated on Friday (21/3) that they have prepared steps to strengthen the role of Bank Indonesia so that it can help the government achieve an economic growth target of +8%. However, Misbakhun did not detail how the role of Bank Indonesia can be enhanced, and no decision has been made yet. The DPR is currently discussing Law No. 4/2023 concerning the development and strengthening of the financial sector, which raises concerns that the revision of these rules will weaken the independence of Bank Indonesia. Previously, Bank Indonesia Governor, Perry Warjiyo, acknowledged that there were discussions about the central bank's mandate in parliamentary discussions, but he expects no change regarding this matter. Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Thursday (20/3) that the government plans to increase nickel and gold royalties by about +1.5-3 percentage points, although he did not provide further details. Previously, the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources held a public consultation earlier this month regarding the draft amendment of royalties for minerals and coal (minerba). CEO of BPI Danantara and Minister of Investment and Downstreaming, Rosan Roeslani, stated on Friday (21/3) that the complete structure of the management filling important positions in Danantara will be announced on Monday afternoon (24/3), although he did not provide further details. Previously, President Prabowo Subianto announced the leadership of Danantara at the end of February 2025, along with the launch of the body.

marketNews.title: China Enterprises Hang Seng Index Plunges
marketNews.content: The China Enterprises Hang Seng Index closed down -2.3% on Friday (21/3), resulting in a -4.6% drop over the last 2 days, marking its sharpest decline since October 9, 2024. According to Bloomberg reports, analysts attribute the decline in the Hang Seng China Enterprises index from its 3-year high to a lack of new catalysts, as the index was considered to have priced in the promise made by the Chinese government earlier this month to support economic expansion and artificial intelligence (AI) development.

tickerNews.title: BBRI February 2025: Net Profit +42% YoY, +129% MoM
tickerNews.content: $BBRI: Bank Rakyat Indonesia recorded net profit (bank only) of 4.6 trillion rupiah in February 2025 (+42% YoY, +129% MoM), a significant recovery from January 2025 net profit. This result caused the net profit of the bank only for 2M25 to drop -18% YoY to 6.6 trillion rupiah, worse than the 2025F consolidated estimate from the consensus (-1.3% YoY), caused by management overlay in January 2025. The net profit growth in February 2025 was driven by a significant decrease in provisioning costs to 3.3 trillion rupiah (-49% YoY, -41% MoM), which was reflected in the bank only's cost of credit (CoC) which flattened to 3.28% (vs. Jan 2025: 5.57%, Feb 2024: 6.72%). Operationally, PPOP dropped -11% YoY in February 2025 due to surging labor expenses (+91% YoY). Meanwhile, the bank only's Net Interest Margin (NIM) remained stable at 6.39% in February 2025 (vs. Feb 2024: 6.17%, Jan 2025: 6.15%). On the other hand, the growth of credit and financing for the bank only grew +5.2% YoY during 2M25 (vs. 2M24: +12.6% YoY, 1M25: +4.6% YoY), with the Loan-to-Deposit Ratio (LDR) remaining high at 88.2%.

tickerNews.title: AMRT Q4 2024 Performance Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: $AMRT: Sumber Alfaria Trijaya recorded net profit of 749 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-38% YoY, +24% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 3.1 trillion rupiah (-8% YoY), below expectations as it only equaled 81% of the 2024F consensus estimate. Revenue in 4Q24 grew to 30 trillion rupiah (+11% YoY, +3% QoQ), bringing total revenue for 2024 to 118.2 trillion rupiah (+11% YoY). Weak operating profit in 4Q24 (-37% YoY, +24% QoQ) was caused by an increase in opex-to-sales to 19.2% (vs. 4Q23: 18.2%, 3Q24: 19.3%), resulting in operating profit margin in 4Q24 dropping to 3.2% (vs. 4Q23: 5.8%, 3Q24: 2.7%).

tickerNews.title: ELSA Q4 2024 Net Profit Surges, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: $ELSA: Elnusa recorded net profit of 162 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+50% QoQ, +68% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 714 billion rupiah (+42% YoY), exceeding our expectations in Unboxing ELSA (106.8% of Stockbit FY24F estimate). The quarterly net profit increase was mainly driven by the reversal of other expenses, particularly due to a reversal of exchange rate gains from a loss of 68 billion rupiah in 3Q24 to a gain of 44 billion rupiah in 4Q24. Operationally, revenue grew +12.2% QoQ, but a decline in gross profit margin (-160 bps QoQ) to 8.5% and an increase in operating expenses (+34% QoQ) caused operating profit to decrease -29.9% QoQ.

tickerNews.title: BREN Q4 2024 Net Profit Grows, Driven by Lower Financing Costs
tickerNews.content: $BREN: Barito Renewables Energy recorded net profit of 36 million US dollars in 4Q24 (+57% YoY, +28% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 2024 of 122 million US dollars (+14% YoY). The quarterly net profit increase was mainly driven by the decrease in net financing expenses to 28 million US dollars (-11% YoY, -7% QoQ) from the refinancing results in September 2024 and a foreign exchange gain of 2 million US dollars (4Q23: loss of 4 million US dollars, 3Q24: loss of 2 million US dollars). Based on Stockbit's calculation, BREN's EBITDA reached 132 million US dollars in 4Q24 (+7% YoY, +5% QoQ), so the EBITDA for 2024 reached 502 million US dollars (+1% YoY).

tickerNews.title: PGAS 2M25 Gas Sales Volume Below Target, Transmission Volume Above Target
tickerNews.content: $PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara recorded gas sales volume of 868 BBtud (+0% YoY) during 2M25, which is about 1-9% lower than the 2025 target in the range of 873-958 BBtud. Meanwhile, gas transmission volume reached 1,569 MMSCFD (+12% YoY) during 2M25, which is +9% higher than the 2025 target of 1,435 MMSCFD. The upstream oil and gas product sales volume reached 16,937 BOEPD (-26% YoY) during 2M25, which is -2% lower than the 2025 target of 17,227 BOEPD.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Q4 2024 Net Profit Under Pressure, Controller Buys Shares
tickerNews.content: $HEAL: Medikaloka Hermina recorded net profit of 68 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-24% YoY, -46% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 536 billion rupiah (+23% YoY), below expectations by only meeting 92% of the 2024F consensus estimate. Operationally, revenue in 4Q24 grew slightly (+9% YoY, +0.5% QoQ), while the margin was relatively flat (gross profit margin: +10 bps YoY, operating profit margin: -10 bps YoY). The annual net profit in 4Q24 was pressed by an increase in financial expenses to 49 billion rupiah (vs. 4Q23: 28 billion rupiah), causing the net profit margin to drop -169 bps YoY. In a separate information disclosure, the controller and President Director of Medikaloka Hermina, Hasmoro, bought approximately 2.4 million HEAL shares at an average price of 1,255.1 rupiah per share on March 17-18, 2025.

tickerNews.title: ERAA Controller Increases Stake via Share Purchase
tickerNews.content: $ERAA: The controller of Erajaya Swasembada, PT Eralink International, bought approximately 39.4 million ERAA shares in the range of ~372 rupiah per share on March 18-19, 2025. The total value of this transaction reached approx. 14.7 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Eralink International's ownership in ERAA shares increased from 54.93% to 55.17%.

tickerNews.title: MIDI Q4 2024 Net Profit Falls, Ending 2024 Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: $MIDI: Midi Utama Indonesia recorded net profit of 80 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-37% YoY, -44% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 546 billion rupiah (+6% YoY), below expectations as it only equaled 92% of the 2024F consensus estimate. Revenue in 4Q24 grew to 5.2 trillion rupiah (+17% YoY, +6% QoQ), bringing total revenue for 2024 to 19.9 trillion rupiah (+15% YoY). Weak operating profit in 4Q24 (-35% YoY, -40% QoQ) was caused by an increase in opex-to-sales to 24.4% (vs. 4Q23: 24%, 3Q24: 24%), so the operating profit margin dropped to 2.1% (vs. 4Q23: 3.9%, 3Q24: 3.8%).

tickerNews.title: ULTJ Plans Share Buyback Up to 10% of Paid-up Capital
tickerNews.content: $ULTJ: Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company plans to conduct a share buyback of up to 10% of the issued and paid-up capital with a cost of approximately 1.7 trillion rupiah from March 24 to June 23, 2025. This plan does not require GMS approval, in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: IMPC Shareholder Increases Stake
tickerNews.content: Shareholder of Impack Pratama Industri ($IMPC), PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa, bought approximately 65.8 million IMPC shares at a price of 304 rupiah per share on March 20, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 20 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa in IMPC increased from 44.99% to 45.11%.

tickerNews.title: BJTM Q4 2024 Net Profit Pressured by Provision Costs, Plans 2025-2026 Bonds
tickerNews.content: Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Timur ($BJTM) recorded net profit of approximately 367 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-2.4% YoY, +19% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 2024 of approximately 1.3 trillion rupiah (-12% YoY). Net profit in 4Q24 was pressured by provision costs soaring to approximately 577 billion rupiah (vs. 4Q23: ~239 billion rupiah, 3Q24: ~209 billion rupiah). On the top-line, BJTM recorded Net Interest Income (NII) growth to approximately 1.7 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (+22% YoY, +22% QoQ). In the analyst meeting on Thursday (20/3), BJTM announced plans to issue bonds worth 5 trillion rupiah in 2025-2026, with bonds in 2025 scheduled to be issued in August or September.

tickerNews.title: GULA Controller Sells Shares for Investment Strategy
tickerNews.content: The controller and President Director of Aman Agrindo ($GULA), Andreas Utomo, sold approximately 21.6 million GULA shares at a price of 324 rupiah per share on March 19, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 7 billion rupiah and was intended for investment strategy. After this transaction, Andreas' ownership in GULA decreased from 17.49% to 15.47%.

tickerNews.title: SRIL Secures New Investor, Plans to Resume Operations Soon
tickerNews.content: Kontan reports that Sri Rejeki Isman ($SRIL) has obtained a new investor and will resume operations in the near future. The Head of the Department of Industry and Manpower of Sukoharjo Regency, Sumarno, stated that 5,000 former employees have been recruited for the company's operations with the new investor. Minister of Manpower, Yassierli, confirmed that former SRIL employees signed employment contracts with the investor on Monday (17/3). Previously, SRIL's operations ceased as of March 1, 2025, after the Semarang Commercial Court declared SRIL bankrupt following a lawsuit from PT Indo Bharat Rayon.
